answers.answer: I'm 36 weeks and I honestly feel like crap ! I've had every symptom in the book since 5 weeks !! :( literally I threw up until almost 4 months pregnant and since 16 weeks I've had veryy swollen feet so I've been seen more often to check it's not preeclampsia I also have high blood pressure and gestational diabetes I've had it all ! I cannot wait to finally have my baby girl in my arms I'm mentally and physically exhausted !!

You sound exactly like me! I had a cake walk of a pregnancy and I feel I deserved it with going through fertility treatment for 2.5yrs and two losses before this one. I love being pregnant and it's been a breeze. I'm due in 9 days so not far behind you! Must have been something in the water at the time for us ;) haha also like you I'm not pooping my pants with worry of a terrible delivery cause I've had it so easy. Just trying to remain positive all will be fine though and I'm not holding any expectations regarding the labor. Whatever happens I'm fine with as long as me and her live.
That makes me feel so much better, yes indeed, as long as we are healthy, we will be fine. Goodluck to us :) Let me know when she is here

I'm 36 weeks and right now i feel like crap. Nausea came back, i think i might have popped my hip or leg out of place because i can barely walk which means i miss another day of work. Braxton hicks are kicking my butt which i thought that you wasn't supposed to feel them. And i have to poop all the time lol other than that i feel fine. I can't wait to meet my little girl. I'm soooo ready to have her

ill be 35 weeks this Thursday and ive been feeling exhausted both mentally and physically,  I can baerly walk my back is killing me and those braxton hicks are alsoo kicking my but making me think its labor... nausea came back as well.. acid reflux, indigestion, swollen feet, insomnia.. you name it lol so ready to meet my baby boy too though but we will make it through.

question: So i'm 39w 2d and therefore due in 5 days. I have had a breeze all my pregnancy, skipped all the 'cons' of pregnancy. No morning sickness, no nausea, no heartburn, no tiredness, no sleeping in the afternoon. I am very excited to meet my baby, how i feel though is worried about how my labor will be, sometimes i feel scared and nervous even when i have been reassured of our health. Normal?
title: How are you honestly feeling?
